sense.name: promise, as a gift or guarantee of future action
sense.examples: I pledge my honor. The transport secretary has pledged to listen to opponents. He pledged fifty dollars to the charity drive. He has pledged that there will never be tax hikes under a government led by him. $500 million was pledged to fight obesity.

sense.name: drink a toast to someone
sense.examples: His hand was steady as he raised his glass and pledged a toast.

sense.name: enroll in a society or contractual relationship
sense.examples: Before you pledged the sorority, how many people had you lived with at one time? He pledged the professional fraternity in his first semester. At any rate, I pledged the organization that I wanted to be a part of. His father pledged him to a ten-year apprenticeship with Master Yu.
